Machine-readable finding aid derived from HTML inventory and directly from the collection
[date of source: January 8, 2010
Finding aid encoded by Valerie Higgins, Library/Archives, Indiana University, January 8, 2010

did.head: Summary Information
did.langmaterial: Materials are in English and French
did.abstract: The Wright B. mss., ca. 1930-2009, consists of the papers of translator Barbara Wright relating to her English translations of French authors.

accessrestrict.head: Access Restrictions
accessrestrict.p: This collection is open for research.

bioghist.head: Biographical Note
bioghist.p: Barbara Wright (1915-2009) is considered one of the premier English translators of modern French literature. An Englishwoman, born in 1915, Wright studied music in Paris in the years before World War II. She began her career as an art and literary critic before devoting her time to translation. She specialized in "poetic prose" and drama, especially French surrealist and existential writing, but she translated works in several genres including women's literature, historical fiction, and fantasy. In 1986 she was made an officer in l'Ordre des Artes et des Lettres in l'Academie Française.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: The collection is arranged into the following series: I. Personal; II. Writings, excluding translations; III. Individuals: correspondence and translations; IV. Organizations and publications; V. Radio: scripts and correspondence; VI. Miscellaneous notebooks; VII. Conferences and events; VIII. Collège de 'Pataphysique; IX. Clippings by subject; X. Photographs; XI. Honors and certificates; XII. Miscellaneous

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Note
scopecontent.p: The Wright B. mss., ca. 1930-2009, consists of the papers of translator Barbara Wright relating to her English translations of French authors. The papers include correspondence with individuals and organizations, notebooks with notes for Wright's translations, drafts of translations, scripts of radio programs Wright translated, reviews of works Wright translated, calendar books, writings by Wright, programs, travel journals, and clippings.

controlaccess.head: Indexing Terms
controlaccess.p: The following terms have been used to index the description of this collection in IUCAT, the IU Libraries' online catalog. Materials about related topics, persons or places can be found by searching the catalog using these terms.

separatedmaterial.head: Separated Material
separatedmaterial.p: Barbara Wright's working library is also available at the Lilly Library

userestrict.head: Usage Restrictions
userestrict.p: Prior arrangements are not necessary before coming to the Library; however, patrons from out of town are encouraged to communicate with the Library in advance of their visits to ascertain availability of materials.
Photocopying permitted only with the permission of the Curator of Manuscripts, Lilly Library

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: [Item], Wright, B. mss., Lilly Library, Indiana University, Bloomington, Indiana

scopecontent.p: Includes belt, necklace, watch, two bracelets, three pairs of earrings, two rings, empty box, and Emma's tooth from 1978, Dec. 18

Additional writings can be found throughout the collection. Materials relating to Wright's translations can be found in the Individuals: Correspondence and Translations series and the Organizations and Publications series. Materials relating to Wright's reports on books for publishers can be found in the Organizations and Publications
